name: Intabank
overview:
Intabank is a market leading International bandwidth exchange which utilises the power of a network of Global Data Centres, to offer businesses the ability to sell remnant connectivity to buyers wanting “burst” or short term Internet capacity.

This also includes the ability for multinational organisations to manage their connectivity across locations - territories and countries.

Intabank is currently located in 10 Data Center locations across 4 Continents and will expand this footprint to another 6 Data Centers (totalling 16 DC’s in all) by the end of 2013.

The Intabank technology is built on Carrier Grade equipment including Cisco and NetApp, utilizing an infrastructure partnership with ASE IT (www.aseit.com.au) and Data Center relationships with Equinix, Global Switch and Next DC.

Typical Buyers of burst bandwidth include:

  • Financial Services: Banking
  • Media Groups: Production Houses (Film & Television)
  • ISP’s (including Residential)
  • CDN’s
  • Any company wishing to purchase bandwidth on a flexible contract basis (Hourly, Daily, Monthly).
  • A group connected to a unilateral peering platform such as LINX, WAIX, PIPEIX, Equinix Exchange and seeking to connect to another peering platform in an alternate location.
  • A business that has Data Centre infrastructure in a Co-Lo environment (eg: Equinix) with the ability to cross-connect with Intabank (a service Intabank will facilitate).
  • A global organisation looking to manage its “territory-by-territory” bandwidth on a global basis.

While sellers can choose from two products:

  1. Burst Bandwidth Speed (by the Mpbs)
  2. Transfer Exchange Window (by the GB)

It takes just 3 simple steps to connect a business to Intabank:

  1. Be in an Intabank Data Centre, or order a local loop to an Intabank Data Center.
  2. Order Cross Connect
  3. Configure your Network (Router)

Note: Intabank has 24/7 (365) support to help with all of these steps.

info@intabank.com | sales@intabank.com
